page.title: 06QUARRYING AND CONSERVATION
page.content: Stone has been quarried for centuries on Mendip - at first for building but now for road stone. {Dulcote Hill}was being extensively quarried earlier in the century and would have been completely removed which would have ruined an attractive view from Wells. Eminent local geologist,{H E Balch, campaigned for the hill to be saved and the northern and western slopes were retained although the height the hill was reduced. The quarry has now closed and is used as a council rubbish dump. Current conservation issues include the work of the{Somerset Trust for {Nature Conservation}which has taken over the overgrown cemetery in East Wells. Controversially they have begun cutting down much of the vegetation. {Wells Golf Club}is expanding to l8 holes at the cost of local woodland.
